docs.lead_paragraph: This novel follows the marriage of a philandering politician and his stoical wife, who live largely separate lives for 20-odd years, until an unforeseen event brings them back together in their old New England home.

headline.seo: The Senator’s Wife - Sue Miller - Book Review
headline.main: Back in His Arms Again: The Home Campaign

docs.lead_paragraph: Just how bad are cold medicines for children? What are the early signs of autism? How do you quiet a colicky infant? Dr. Alan Greene is a clinical professor of pediatrics at Stanford University and the founder of parenting Web site drgreene.com. His most recent book, "Raising Baby Green," explores environmentally aware approaches to children's health. You may post your questions below. Please remember that Dr. Greene cannot answer all of them, and he cannot respond to solicitations for personal medical advice. [Eds. note: We are no longer accepting questions.]

headline.main: A New You: Dr. Alan Greene on Parenting and Children's Health
